introduction.p: For Problems 12, decide whether the ordered pairs are solutions of the equation whose graph is shown.
For Problems 36, decide whether the ordered pairs are solutions of the given equation.
For Problems 78, state the interval that each grid line represents on the horizontal and vertical axes.

li.p: What interval does each grid line represent on the horizontal axis? On the vertical axis?
Plot the following points on the grid: (0,500),~(20, 1750),~(40, 250)
What interval does each grid line represent on the horizontal axis? On the vertical axis?
Find the coordinates of each point.

introduction.p: For Problems 1518, solve the inequality and graph the solutions on a number line.
For Problems 19-24, solve for y in terms of x.

statement.p: The figure shows a graph of y =\dfrac{-x}{3} - 6.

li.p:
Use the graph to find all values of x for which
y=-4
y\gt -4
y\lt -4
Explain why your answers to parts (a) and (b) are the same.

statement.p: The figure shows the graph of y = -2.4x + 2.32. Use the graph to solve:
The figure shows the graph of y = 1.4x - 0.64. Use the graph to solve:

sidebyside.p:
y=0.8-kx Use the graph to solve:
0.8-kx \ge 0.2
0.5 \gt 0.8-kx

y=mx+b Use the graph to solve:
mx+b=1200
-800=mx+b
mx+b>400
-1200\ge mx+b

introduction.p: In Problems 31 and 32, graph each equation in the window

statement.p:
Graph y=-0.4x + 3.7. Use the graph to solve the equation or inequality. Then check your answers algebraically.
Solve -0.4x+3.7=2.1
Solve -0.4x+3.7 \gt -5.1

Graph y= 6.5 - 18x. Use the graph to answer the questions. Then check your answers algebraically.
For what value of x is y=-13.3?
For what value of x is y=24.5?
For what values of x is y \le 15.5?
For what values of x is y \ge -7.9?
